page.title: 07Yarlet Hall School
page.content: As mentioned earlier,there is no state school in out areabut there is a fee-paying school on the A34,called Yarlet Hall.The building was originally a private house,though it was never lived in as such.The school began in 1872:it has about 7 acres of land which consist of playing fields,an orchard,kitchen garden,a swimming pool.staff housing and the main school building. There are about 130 boys aged from 7 to 13 and 8 full time members of the teaching staff.Subjects taught include French,English,Latin,mathematics,histo ry,geography.science and scripture.Music,tennis ans P.E.are taught by visiting teachers.There are full-time groundsmen,together with a number of domestic staff. The boys are prepared for an exam
